li.p: Before starting the work instruction activity, perform the following steps:
Do not begin these tasks without confirmation that personnel directly involved have completed the required training associated with the work instruction activity and have reviewed this document.
Gather all necessary tools and equipment as identified below in the Equipment Section.
Wear and use any additional Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and safety equipment required for this specific work instruction.
Obey all applicable safety requirements and procedures.
Notify all appropriate personnel of the activity and estimated time needed to complete the tasks.
Follow all Lockout/Tagout procedures when work instruction activity requires isolating energy in the designated area. Verify energy is isolated before starting work.
Only after energy is verified to be isolated, can the protective guarding be removed and safety interlock gates be opened.
To maintain Hot End Treatment Hoods, perform the following steps:
Visually inspect pump for proper operation.
Visually inspect air pressure regulator, lubricator, and filter.
Visually inspect all blowers for operation and proper seal to the hood.
Visually inspect proper operating temperature inside the hood.
If applicable, visually inspect the finish blower filter. Replace as necessary.
If applicable, lubricate the piston drive pump according to manufacturerâ€™s specification.
If applicable, visually inspect the desiccant cylinder. Replace as necessary.
Visually inspect the proper operation of the control flowmeter condition and alarm operation.
If applicable, record pressure and vacuum readings.
If applicable, verify proper operation of the scale.
If anything is out of specification, notify the appropriate SAP PM contact to issue a planned work order.
Upon completion of tasks, perform the following steps:
Replace the protective guarding and close the safety interlock gates.
Confirm that the designated work area is clear and communicate to personnel the intent to restart energy.

After the designated work area is confirmed clear and personnel are aware of the pending restart, follow all Lockout/Tagout procedures to restart the energy supplied to the designated area. Verify that the energy is active.
Perform basic housekeeping duties. Clean up the work space, tools, and equipment. Dispose of trash. Put tools and equipment in their assigned areas.
Record and report findings and results.
Follow appropriate instructions for notification of findings and results relating to specifications, targets and/or reaction limits.
